meanings.definition: Understanding of a situation or event only after it has happened.
meanings.sent1: In hindsight, I realized I should have studied more for the test.
meanings.sent2: She only understood the mistake in hindsight, after the project was completed.
meanings.sent3: Looking back with hindsight, I can't believe I wore mismatched socks to the party.
meanings.sent4: Hindsight is like a pair of glasses that only work after the show is over.
meanings.sent5: The regret of hindsight can be a tough teacher, but it helps us learn.

meanings.definition: The ability to understand an event or situation only after it has happened.
meanings.sent1: With hindsight, he saw where he went wrong in the game.
meanings.sent2: The team learned from their mistakes in hindsight, improving their strategy.
meanings.sent3: Using hindsight, she realized she should have taken the umbrella before leaving the house.
meanings.sent4: Hindsight is like a light bulb that only turns on after the power outage.
meanings.sent5: The power of hindsight can guide us to better decisions in the future.
